Ratings.comment:
Creeps on the women. bad grade if you don't show up for extra Zoom meets outside of class. Requires proof of absence (doctor's note or obituary like we're in grade school) 
Same lecture repeated throughout term, didn't learn actual typography practice, EMPLOYERS say they don't care to see projects from this class. waste of time and money.

Wastes so much time in class. I think he just likes hearing himself talk. Repeated same lecture probably ten times instead of giving individual feedback, forcing people to stay after class. Critiques our work, then goes back on it after we make changes. Really creepy towards girls and lacks personal space / boundaries / general respect.

Graded on one task all year. 5 minutes late equals a full absence. Heavy workload 10+ pages per class. Assignments given are abstract and experimental, benefiting our future careers in design in no way. Spends an hour or two talking about nonsense so, he demands after-class meetings, claiming they're optional, but they're crucial for a good grade.

Keith tough me SO much through out this semester; from typography, to work ethics. At first I thought he was odd and didnt like him as a prof, but boy was I wrong. Hes literally like a sensei in a karate movie that the kid hates at first because of the harsh work the senseis making him do, but then realizes how lucky he is be under his wing.

Keith is the best, most interesting, and most inspirational professor I have ever had. He Knows what he is doing. I trust his opinion and I have learned so much from him. I would not be the designer I am now without Keith. He knows how to critique in an extremely productive manner for the learner. His aesthetic for design is exceptional.
